meanings.definition: The quality of being spacious or roomy.
meanings.sent1: The capaciousness of the warehouse allowed for easy storage of all the boxes.
meanings.sent2: The new house's capaciousness made it perfect for hosting large family gatherings.
meanings.sent3: The capaciousness of the closet was so vast that it seemed to swallow up all the clothes inside.
meanings.sent4: Her heart had a capaciousness that welcomed everyone with open arms.
meanings.sent5: The capaciousness of the field stretched out endlessly, inviting children to run and play.

meanings.definition: The state of having a large capacity or volume.
meanings.sent1: The capaciousness of the pitcher allowed it to hold a whole gallon of water.
meanings.sent2: The capaciousness of the suitcase made it easy to pack all her clothes for the trip.
meanings.sent3: The capaciousness of the refrigerator was put to the test during the holiday feast.
meanings.sent4: His mind had a capaciousness that absorbed knowledge like a sponge.
meanings.sent5: The capaciousness of the library was a book lover's dream come true.
